item.title: Derezzed
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Just thought I’d let you know the whole Tron album’s been leaked already. You can find it on youtube.

I am rather…disappointed with it. The majority of it is terribly Hans Zimmer-esque orchestra pieces (think Inception, fast repeating violin + deep booming brass) . You can only really hear their influence in a few songs, and only 2 or 3 are “really” Daft Punk, if you understand me. There was almost no point in slapping their name onto this project except to promote the movie. I realize for the actual soundtrack in the movie, the music needs to be suitable to play in the background and fit the mood, but we are treated to little Daft Punk-style even on the CD, which could have included plenty of songs not in the movie. I don’t hate the soundtrack, but it’s definitely not thrilling me. Probably just gonna buy the best tracks online, instead of getting the CD. I guess the focus has shifted onto the actual movie for me now (shocking!). I just hope this isn’t going to delay an actual studio album for another few years though, because this is hardly satisfying.

Read full topic

item.title: Derezzed
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

I’ve only heard a few of their songs honestly. When I listen to a single artist too much I often start to dislike them. The few songs of theirs I have liked though.

I had a friend in high school who was obsessed with trance. That shit was crazy repetitive. It usually sounded pretty cool, (minus repetition) but the songs were way too long 9/10 of the time.

Techno and Trance (in their purest forms) are the worst in my view. Simply because they are usually the cheapest overall. But since they get a lot of exposure - they contribute a lot to bad image.

Best guys out there don’t operate within a genre margin. They just write music:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5YNeAYL6Bps
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u4wS2TI0oEw&feature=related
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yqh0VQljnJY&feature=related
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yauzpd9mmbs&feature=related

Planisphere is, of course, more of an exception, but it shows how you can handle the beat without boring the shit out of everyone.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qVXRNae5QAk
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E18vNqxZ4ak&feature=related
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k53dRzjnj_w
Boys Noize - repetitive if you care to notice, but the samples and beats are crazy enough to listen to them, forever.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vPUa67AHemk
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JOnYy9rNO0g
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HuVbgCoSwVQ
BLDBTRTS - craziest shit out there, and they get the financing they need.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jXzggiUalxo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SQSHg-SJXR8
Fucking Kavinsky.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RlJGLGFEvHo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QEtGQzZoZSE
Fucking Sebastian.

I can go on and on posting examples of today’s european electro scene… le castle vania, grum, Toxic Avenger, Soulwax…
Oh, and Shinichi Osawa of course. And Prodigy.
Oh, and Mr. Oizo.

Those are not your regular trance/dance/techno crap.

And then those guys remix each other.

Read full topic

item.title: Derezzed
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

Honestly, they always tend to have the most repetitive songs, but everyone loves them anyway.
They were not even robots before Discovery. But then they had that Dog guy.

This is true. Their album Human After All is the worst offender, with the majority of the songs having little to no variety (it was, after all, made in 6 weeks, for whatever reason). They sounded pretty good, but they were highly criticized for repetitiveness. A lot of people even thought the album was a fake when it got leaked. But when their Alive tour came, everyone was blown away by how awesome it was, and then they felt bad for doubting them, so I think a lot of people are kind of blindly loving them again. Me, I love their music still, but I won’t say that all their songs are great, or that they can do no wrong.

item.title: Derezzed
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Electronica and Hip-Hop are the general terms usually.

They are very similar styles

Last few years’ electronica (electro house being the most prominent example) has a strong rock vibe to it. No classic house/trance repetitive shit going on.
Mainstream dance music does not appeal to me one bit (even though it has some decent vocals quite often) unless I’m in a night club.

And about excessive repetitiveness - basically it means that the song is in fact cheap/badly made (released free on web/b-side). Once electronic acts get on the commercial stage - suddenly their shit gets much less repetitive. Either that, or they focus on quantity. they just produce a shitton of material on a very rapid pace. Songs get forgotten one after another. Or get some guest vocals onboard, which really helps covering up shitty production. Heck, today’s pop music is just electronica, only with shitty vocals as opposed to electronic producers.

Daft Punk is the only act that seemed to get away with excessive looping through the years. But heck, they get away with everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Derezzed
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Orpheon:

I do also feel the best techno is usually the least repetitive

I feel the same way. I know all music is repetitive, but electronic music seems to bore me the most. Some of my favorite songs are electronic.

Orpheon:

Well, yes, but most people use techno to refer to all types of electronic music, whether its actually techno or house or trance or whatever. Not quite sure why that is.

I thought about putting “electronica” in my post, but put techno instead. They are very similar styles, so I just call all electronic music techno, even if it’s house, dance, electronica, whatever. Same with rap, hip-hop, and R&B, I call it all rap.

Read full topic
